conclusion: Understanding the problem about a detector moving along the x-axis with velocity inversely proportional to displacement.
Velocity at point A is 4 m/s, at point B is 2 m/s, and displacement from O to B is 2 meters.
Velocity v is inversely proportional to displacement x, so v = k/x.
Using point B to find k: 2 = k / 2, so k = 4.
Using point A to find x_A: 4 = 4 / x_A, so x_A = 1 m.
Displacement from O to A is 1 meter.
Setting up the integral to find time: dx/x = k dt.
Integrating from x = 1 to x = 2 gives ln(2) = k t.
Setting up dt = (x/k) dx and integrating gives t = 3/8 seconds.
Rechecking steps: v = 4/x, dx/dt = 4/x, separate variables: dx/x = 4 dt.
Integrating both sides: ln(2) = 4t, so t = ln(2)/4.
Solving the differential equation: x^2/2 = 4t + C.
Finding constant C using initial condition: C = 1/2.
Finding t when x goes from 1 to 2 gives t = 3/8 seconds.
